page.title: 09VILLAGE LIFE IN HALSETOWN.
page.content: The people we spoke to in Halsetown enjoy their{life style.}Halsetown is quiet, the atmosphere relaxed, and the lay-out of the village ensures privacy. Halsetown boasts a genuine, old-style {village store,}where pen-knives, picture-postcards, batteries and sun-oil vie for position with all the usual groceries. Self-selection and the check out till have been firmly resisted, and proprietor Willy Dunn finds time for a chat as he dispenses life's necessities. Born in the village 62 years ago, Willy is something of a{local {character.}His parents moved into the house on the cross-roads 60 years ago and converted it to a shop. According to Willy the character of the village is less friendly. Newcomers have renovated derelict cottages.
